methodology.description: Risk aggregation based on pre-extracted exposures from orchestrator-state.md QUANTIFIED_EXPOSURES section. Time-based classification applied with DCF adjustments for multi-year liabilities. Correlation adjustments applied to related environmental exposures.
methodology.probability_methodology: Per-finding analyst estimates from specialist reports, with severity-based defaults where not stated

ip_value_destruction.note: One exposure is percentage-based (80% discount), dollar amount represents $500M manufacturer case study

deal_adjustments.note: Negative values represent offsets/benefits that reduce total exposure

exposure_ranges.methodology: P10/P50/P90 calculated for range-based exposures (Westinghouse $40-60M, Large facility $40-200M, Medium facility $10-35M)

correlation_adjustments.methodology: Environmental exposures (CERCLA, remediation, penalties) show 70% correlation due to same-facility overlap. Applied 0.7 correlation factor with 30% overlap assumption.

pairs_adjusted.rationale: Same manufacturing facilities appear in multiple environmental categories (e.g., LTV Steel had CERCLA sites AND violations)

one_time.note: Historical penalties, filed claims, and single-event exposures

multi_year.note: Remediation programs over 5-10 years, discounted at 8%

perpetual.note: Arch Coal reclamation liability (disclosed liability already at NPV)

escrow_recommendation.calculation_basis: HIGH severity exposures + 20% buffer, adjusted for correlation

medium_facility.rationale: 1.5x multiplier on midpoint, accounts for remediation uncertainty

escrow_analysis.time_horizon_note: Most exposures are ONE_TIME or completed. Multi-year remediation programs require extended escrow periods (5-10 years) or R&W insurance.
escrow_analysis.recommended_release_schedule: 20% at 12 months, 30% at 24 months, 30% at 36 months, 20% at 60 months (extended for multi-year remediation)
adequacy_flags: Escrow exceeds correlation-adjusted expected exposure ($970M vs $808M)
Multi-year remediation exposures require extended hold periods
Reclamation liability ($640M) is perpetual - consider R&W insurance wrap

critical_findings.rationale: Represents 73% of total documented exposure, perpetual obligation
10+ year multi-phase program with 30-year monitoring tail

top_10_exposures.note: Percentage-based exposure based on Kodak case study (80% value destruction in distressed sale)

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Arch Coal reclamation liability (11% of assets, perpetual obligation)
Three remediation programs: Westinghouse Sharon ($42.8M PV), Large facility typical ($95M PV), Medium facility typical ($18M PV)
Historical enforcement penalties: U.S. Steel Clairton ($24.5M), Allegheny Ludlum CWA ($8.2M)
LTV Steel CERCLA claims across 14 Superfund sites
IP impairment risk in distressed sales: 80% discount in auction (40% probability), $19.5M expected value for $500M manufacturer
Environmental liability offset potential through strategic bankruptcy plan classification (46-83% offset range)

key_insights: Reclamation liability dominates exposure: $640M (73% of total) from single energy sector case
Environmental exposures are correlated: 70% correlation factor applied, reducing combined exposure by $44M (21%)
Multi-year remediation programs require extended escrow periods (5-10 years) due to long-tail monitoring obligations
IP value destruction risk is event-driven: 80% discount in distressed auctions vs. 16% in going-concern restructuring
Environmental offset potential: 46-83% of environmental liabilities can be discharged/offset through strategic bankruptcy planning
Time-based classification matters: $36.7M difference between nominal and present value for multi-year programs
Typical facility exposure ranges: Small ($3-8M), Medium ($10-35M), Large ($40-200M) lifecycle costs

limitations.data_sources: Based on 5 specialist reports covering 10 major manufacturing bankruptcies (2000-2025)
limitations.temporal_scope: Historical cases, current regulatory framework may differ
limitations.quantification_uncertainty: Ranges provided for typical facilities ($40-200M), actual exposure depends on facility size, contamination type, and regulatory approach
limitations.correlation_assumptions: 70% correlation for environmental exposures based on same-facility overlap patterns in dataset
limitations.offset_probability: 46-83% offset range based on strategic bankruptcy planning outcomes, actual results depend on plan structure and court approval
